description: An aggregation of links by the reporters and editors of Diner’s Journal.
title: The New York Times
title_page: What We're Reading - The New York Times
text:
Daniel Barry/Bloomberg News
Grub Street: Nate Appleman, ex of Pulino’s, is helping Chipotle make a better burrito. – Nick Fox
Harvest to Heat: A recipe for edible Christmas tree ornaments, from Gramercy Tavern pastry chef Nancy Olson — also check out the iPad app for a cross-country guide to farmers and the chefs who love them. (Or buy the book for the serious cook on your list.) – Julia Moskin
BusinessWeek: Study says stricter testing won’t improve food safety for school and other institutional lunches. – Sam Sifton
Specialty Food: American food products and Hong Kong: made for each other. United States food exports will reach a record $2 billion level this year, making the foodie mecca Hong Kong, amazingly, the fourth largest export market (after Canada, Mexico and Japan). – Glenn Collins
Tablas Creek Blog: Jason Haas makes the case for dry farming and biodynamic viticulture. – Eric Asimov
The Daily Mail: Jamie Oliver’s latest book “Jamie’s 30-minute Meals” has become the fastest selling book of non-fiction in Britain. The record was previously held by an English comedian. – Samantha Storey
Wine Spectator: Matt Kramer makes the case against fussy food-and-wine pairings. – Eric Asimov
CNET: Paging Danny Meyer! Chinese restaurant introduces robot waiters. – Sam Sifton
Chesapeake Bay Journal: Rona Kobell’s important and very good three-part series on oyster aquaculture is now online, with tons of bells and whistles. – Sam Sifton
Food News Journal: Always! (Today’s treat, a link to Mario Batali’s Proust questionnaire in Vanity Fair. – Sam Sifton
The Wall Street Journal: The latest trend in Hong Kong? “New York-style” restaurants. – Nick Fox
The Atlantic: Michael Romano reminisces about his first days at the Union Square Cafe. – Samantha Storey
